body_html:
I guess another main difference is where computation begins. In Bahdanau papers, the path is h(t-1)->a(t)->c(t)->h(t), while in Luong it should be h(t)->a(t)->c(t)->h˜(t).

In current implements, both Bahdanau and Luong use current hidden state h(t) as "query" to attend on memories. I am not sure whether this matters a lot or not.
body_text:
I guess another main difference is where computation begins. In Bahdanau papers, the path is h(t-1)->a(t)->c(t)->h(t), while in Luong it should be h(t)->a(t)->c(t)->h˜(t).
In current implements, both Bahdanau and Luong use current hidden state h(t) as "query" to attend on memories. I am not sure whether this matters a lot or not.
body:
I guess another main difference is where computation begins. In Bahdanau papers, the path is h(t-1)->a(t)->c(t)->h(t), while in Luong it should be h(t)->a(t)->c(t)->h˜(t).

In current implements, both Bahdanau and Luong use current hidden state h(t) as "query" to attend on memories. I am not sure whether this matters a lot or not.
